sections.title: Electrical Safety and Hazards
prompts: Explain the potential hazards of electrical current flowing through the human body, including tissue heating, cell disruption, and muscle contractions.
Describe the purpose of a fuse in an electrical circuit and why replacing a fuse with a higher-rated one can be dangerous.
Discuss the importance of proper grounding in electrical systems and how it prevents electrical shock.
Explain the role of a lightning arrester in a coaxial feed line and where it should be installed for optimal safety.

sections.title: Tower Installation and Climbing Safety
prompts: Explain the importance of proper grounding for antenna towers and how it contributes to lightning protection.
Describe the safety precautions necessary when climbing an antenna tower, including the use of climbing harnesses and tie-offs.
Discuss the risks associated with climbing a tower without a helper or observer and why it should never be done.
Explain the purpose of a safety wire in a turnbuckle used for tensioning guy lines and how it prevents loosening due to vibration.

sections.title: RF Radiation and Exposure Safety
concepts: Duty cycle and its impact on RF safety
prompts: Explain the difference between ionizing and non-ionizing radiation, focusing on why radio signals are classified as non-ionizing.
Describe how the allowable power density for RF safety changes with variations in duty cycle.
Discuss the factors that affect RF exposure near an amateur station antenna, including frequency, power level, and distance.
Explain the methods available to determine whether a station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations, including calculations, computer modeling, and field strength measurements.
